page.title: 02Dorset River
page.content: The river Stour though known as the Dorset river begins life as several springs in the extesive grounds of Stourhead Houses, 4km into neighbouring Wiltshire .When just into Dorset, its waters are swelled by the rivers Shreen and Lodden.The three rivers form part of the local town badge.The Stour is well bordered by trees such as oak,blackthorn,willow and ash.The recent outbreak of Dutch Elm disease killed hundreds of Elm trees and effected water levels.The birds that live beside the river are mainly moorhen and yellow Wagtail, with the accasional vivid blue flash of the Kingfisher,Otters have flourished here for hundreds of years but nowadays they are a rare sight.
